page.title: 07Barkestone cereal farming
page.content: Cereal farming is growing crops.The crops are rye wheat barley and oil seed rape.The seed is sown by tractors.Then it is left and then fertiliser is put on it.Then it is sprayed then after it is grown you combine it.Then the ground is ploughed ready for the next.The fertiliser is spread with a spinner on the back of a tractor.One farmer would drive the combine and another man would go along beside on a tractor and trailer collecting the grain.The grain is then stored in corn bins or barns .Then lorries come to collect it.Then it is taken to Immingham to be loaded on to ships for export.Some small fields have been made bigger by pulling up the hedges because the farm machinery is made much bigger.
